prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing thank-you greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

üé® CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clich√© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Thank you for attending, thank you for helping prosper thought. include a nice quote in left interior. front Cover:  include John Gilbert clearly and mention ‚ÄúAI For Good Conference Stanford CA June 2025‚Äù. make the artwork in general beautiful, charming, but also appropriately professional. Include a nice tree in front cover. don‚Äôt draw any people. use light color theme"
Style: ‚ú® Smart Style
Tone: üåü Inspirational - motivating and uplifting
To: John Gilbert
From: Vibecarding.com Team
Message: "John,

Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone.

With sincere appreciation,
The Vibecarding.com Team"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front ‚Üí interior ‚Üí back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the motivating and uplifting tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way








Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "thank-you" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a luminous, soft-focus watercolor style, evoking the gentle morning light filtering through Stanford's iconic architecture. The front cover features a majestic, sprawling oak tree, its leaves rendered in a delicate wash of warm greens, sunny yellows, and soft ochre, symbolizing wisdom, growth, and prosperity of thought. The tree stands on a gentle slope, with the background hinting at sandstone arches and red-tiled roofs, all softened and blended with a dreamy, wet-on-wet technique. The colors are light and airy‚Äîthink pale sky blues, creamy ivories, and a touch of warm terra-cotta‚Äîcreating a feeling of optimism and serene beauty. The text "John Gilbert" and "AI For Good Conference, Stanford CA, June 2025" are integrated into the design with an elegant, hand-lettered serif font in a deep, earthy grey, feeling both personal and distinguished. The overall effect is one of quiet gratitude and organic intelligence, where the "AI for Good" theme is represented not by technology, but by the natural, flourishing beauty of a nurtured idea.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a thank-you card with motivating and uplifting tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a luminous, soft-focus watercolor style, evoking the gentle morning light filtering through Stanford's iconic architecture. The front cover features a majestic, sprawling oak tree, its leaves rendered in a delicate wash of warm greens, sunny yellows, and soft ochre, symbolizing wisdom, growth, and prosperity of thought. The tree stands on a gentle slope, with the background hinting at sandstone arches and red-tiled roofs, all softened and blended with a dreamy, wet-on-wet technique. The colors are light and airy‚Äîthink pale sky blues, creamy ivories, and a touch of warm terra-cotta‚Äîcreating a feeling of optimism and serene beauty. The text "John Gilbert" and "AI For Good Conference, Stanford CA, June 2025" are integrated into the design with an elegant, hand-lettered serif font in a deep, earthy grey, feeling both personal and distinguished. The overall effect is one of quiet gratitude and organic intelligence, where the "AI for Good" theme is represented not by technology, but by the natural, flourishing beauty of a nurtured idea.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "John,

Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone.

With sincere appreciation,
The Vibecarding.com Team" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clich√© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in a luminous, soft-focus watercolor style, evoking the gentle morning light filtering through Stanford's iconic architecture. The front cover features a majestic, sprawling oak tree, its leaves rendered in a delicate wash of warm greens, sunny yellows, and soft ochre, symbolizing wisdom, growth, and prosperity of thought. The tree stands on a gentle slope, with the background hinting at sandstone arches and red-tiled roofs, all softened and blended with a dreamy, wet-on-wet technique. The colors are light and airy‚Äîthink pale sky blues, creamy ivories, and a touch of warm terra-cotta‚Äîcreating a feeling of optimism and serene beauty. The text "John Gilbert" and "AI For Good Conference, Stanford CA, June 2025" are integrated into the design with an elegant, hand-lettered serif font in a deep, earthy grey, feeling both personal and distinguished. The overall effect is one of quiet gratitude and organic intelligence, where the "AI for Good" theme is represented not by technology, but by the natural, flourishing beauty of a nurtured idea.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a luminous, soft-focus watercolor style, evoking the gentle morning light filtering through Stanford's iconic architecture. The front cover features a majestic, sprawling oak tree, its leaves rendered in a delicate wash of warm greens, sunny yellows, and soft ochre, symbolizing wisdom, growth, and prosperity of thought. The tree stands on a gentle slope, with the background hinting at sandstone arches and red-tiled roofs, all softened and blended with a dreamy, wet-on-wet technique. The colors are light and airy‚Äîthink pale sky blues, creamy ivories, and a touch of warm terra-cotta‚Äîcreating a feeling of optimism and serene beauty. The text "John Gilbert" and "AI For Good Conference, Stanford CA, June 2025" are integrated into the design with an elegant, hand-lettered serif font in a deep, earthy grey, feeling both personal and distinguished. The overall effect is one of quiet gratitude and organic intelligence, where the "AI for Good" theme is represented not by technology, but by the natural, flourishing beauty of a nurtured idea.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover:
```json
{
  "frontCover": "Front cover of a greeting card, 9:16 aspect ratio, in a stylized flat illustration art style with smooth gradients and clean lines. The scene depicts a courtyard with arches and a muted orange, sandstone-like architectural style, bathed in a soft, warm, almost sunset-like light. In the center foreground stands a dark, silhouetted tree with its branches forming an intricate circuit board pattern, rendered in a glowing pale yellow and white, symbolizing the \"AI For Good\" theme and the prosperity of thought. The background sky is a gradient of soft peach to a lighter beige at the top. The text \"John Gilbert\" is prominently displayed in a bold, dark grey sans-serif font below the tree. Beneath it, \"AI For Good Conference\", \"Stanford CA\", and \"June 2025\" are stacked in the same font, slightly smaller. The overall mood is professional, inspiring, and subtly sophisticated, using a light color theme with warm undertones.",
  "backCover": "Back cover of a greeting card, 9:16 aspect ratio, continuing the stylized flat illustration art style. The background is a soft gradient of peach to light beige, matching the front cover. In the bottom right corner, a roughly 1-inch square area is left completely clear. The rest of the cover features a minimalist design of the lower portion of the silhouetted tree from the front cover, with its trunk and exposed roots subtly rendered in dark brown. Wisps of the glowing pale yellow circuit board pattern from the tree's canopy are subtly integrated into the upper part of the design, fading into the background gradient. The overall mood is serene, peaceful, and a subtle echo of the front cover's theme, emphasizing a sense of resolution.",
  "leftInterior": "Left interior page of a greeting card, 9:16 aspect ratio, in a stylized flat illustration art style with smooth gradients and clean lines, maintaining the light, warm color theme. The background is a soft gradient of peach to light beige, similar to the front cover. The page features a continuation of the architectural elements, showing more of the arched colonnade in a muted orange hue, suggesting a scholarly or institutional setting like Stanford. The ground is a light beige tiled surface. Subtle, abstract organic shapes or soft, blurred lines inspired by the circuit board motif are lightly overlaid or integrated into the background, creating a sense of intellectual growth and interconnectedness without being overly explicit. The \"AI For Good\" theme is evoked through this subtle visual language, and the overall mood is inspiring and contemplative, fostering a sense of wisdom and thoughtful development.",
  "rightInterior": "Right interior page of a greeting card, 9:16 aspect ratio, in a stylized flat illustration art style with smooth gradients and clean lines, maintaining the light, warm color theme. The background is a soft gradient of peach to light beige. The focus is on presenting the message text in a beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. The text \"John, Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone. With sincere appreciation, The Vibecarding.com Team\" is written in an elegant, legible, handwritten cursive script with a deep charcoal or dark grey ink, conveying warmth and personality. The text is artfully arranged within the center of the page, surrounded by abstract, organic-inspired decorative elements. These elements might include soft, flowing lines and subtle glowing accents that echo the circuit board motif from the front cover, presented in pale yellow and white, interwoven with delicate washes of color that complement the architectural background. The overall effect is sophisticated, uplifting, and heartfelt, with the design framing the message beautifully."
}
```
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a minimalist, elegant aesthetic. The background is a very light cream or off-white, textured subtly to resemble paper. In the upper left quadrant, a stylized branch-like design is rendered in a rich, metallic gold or deep ochre line art. This design evokes circuitry pathways, with branching lines and small circles at the ends, reminiscent of nodes or connections. Extending from the rightmost part of this design are a few small, scattered golden dots, suggesting a subtle shimmer or data points. The overall composition is clean and sophisticated, with the majority of the space left intentionally blank, creating a sense of openness and calm. There is no text on this panel, and the design is strategically placed to allow ample negative space, likely to accommodate a QR code in the bottom right corner without visual obstruction. The style is flat 2D, with no 3D elements or shading, focusing purely on the clean lines and color. It provides a quiet, understated conclusion to the visual narrative, hinting at the technological and growth themes in a very abstract and artistic manner. The artistic style is consistent with a modern, clean graphic design.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a "Smart Style" aesthetic, featuring a quote about creating the future. The artwork is in a luminous, soft-focus style, reminiscent of early morning light. The central element is a stylized tree with roots that subtly incorporate circuit-like patterns, symbolizing the intersection of nature and technology, or organic growth of ideas. The branches of the tree ascend upwards, forming a graceful, organic canopy that fills the upper portion of the frame. The color palette is dominated by soft, warm gradients, transitioning from a pale peach or apricot at the bottom to a gentle, diffused yellow or cream at the top. The lines of the tree and roots are rendered in a light, almost glowing golden or pale yellow hue. The quote, "The best way to predict the future is to create it.", is prominently displayed in the center of the image, enclosed within the implied space created by the tree's trunk and upper branches. The typography is a clean, modern sans-serif font in a dark, muted grey or charcoal, ensuring readability while complementing the soft background colors. The overall mood is inspirational and thought-provoking, conveying a sense of optimism and forward-thinking. The composition is symmetrical and balanced, with the tree motif acting as a visual anchor. The 9:16 aspect ratio is maintained with full-bleed backgrounds, ensuring the design extends to all edges. The style evokes a feeling of intellectual growth and innovation, aligning with the "AI for Good" theme without explicitly depicting technology in a literal or complex manner.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior:
Right interior page of a thank-you greeting card designed for message space with elegant, minimalist decorative elements framing the text. The background is a soft, creamy beige, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The core of the page is dominated by the message, written in a beautiful, flowing black cursive script that is highly legible and appears to be handwritten with a fine-tipped pen. The script has natural character, with subtle variations in line weight and an overall sophisticated yet approachable feel. The message reads: "John, Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone. With sincere appreciation, The Vibecarding.com Team".

The decorative elements consist of thin, stylized golden lines that resemble a circuit board pattern. These lines extend from the top-left and bottom-right corners, subtly reaching towards the center of the page without encroaching on the main text block. The circuit board motif is abstract and geometric, with small circular nodes at the ends of the lines, suggesting connectivity and progression. The gold color is a soft, matte finish, providing a touch of understated elegance. These decorative borders are intentionally sparse, ensuring ample white space for the message and preventing any visual clutter. The overall aesthetic is modern, sophisticated, and subtly thematic, reflecting the "AI for Good" context without being overtly technological. The composition is balanced, with the text centered and the decorative elements acting as a refined frame.
